comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The January 9, 1916 New York Press ran a story about the winter sports at Tuxedo Lake, nearby to society colony Tuxedo Park, in New York's Ramapo Valley. Included is a picture of Ethel Barrymore being pushed in one of the skating chairs depicted in some of these photos. fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%2018/New%20York%20NY%20Press/... See also: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuxedo_Park,_New_York

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Tuxedo Park is "One of the oldest gated communities in the country, founded in the mid 1880s," according to www.forbes.com/pictures/ejef45eeed/tuxedo-park-tuxedo-par... New-York tribune. 02 Jan. 1916. Page 13, column 4 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1916-01-02/ed-... is another article about society winter sports at Tuxedo, including skating on "the big lake" and a rink.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
artolog and swanq:

Thanks for the further information on Tuxedo Lake and the community of Tuxedo Park, NY. We will add more information to the record.
